email_content:
Hi Michael,

Thank you for sharing the latest draft. I’ve had a chance to read through it and wanted to pass along a few thoughts.

• The character development has grown noticeably stronger since the last version. Your portrayal of the central relationships feels nuanced and authentic.

• The pacing in the third act slows a bit and risks diffusing the story’s tension. Tightening some of the transitional moments or trimming certain scenes might help maintain momentum as you move toward the climax.

Overall, the voice and thematic layering are compelling. I’m excited to see how the next revision evolves and am happy to chat further if that would be helpful.

Best,
[Your Name]

Jane and her husband, John, have been experiencing relationship problems.
relationship problems related to her marriage of Jane and her husband
They seem to be speaking different emotional languages, which is draining.
Jane sees echoes of their issues in the manuscript's central couple, providing her with deeper insight into the characters' motivations.
